description:
This is a sort of "standard" deck for Star of the city diff and above. What you should focus on is getting up your emotions through clashes to get EGO and easily win the game. I believe this is truly the way to go after the Liu Association fight.

Although I say Floor of History is recommended, any floor with EGO should work fine with this setup. Although I think History and Arts is the strongest floor for AOE atm.

The core part of this deck is the additional effect you put on the page, mainly "fervor", the rest is just bonuses.

You can replace one of the cards with an "exclusive card" for the Page.

If you do not have Somber Procuration, you can replace it with another 2 costs. 

If you think the deck is too expensive, simply replace one of 2 cost (not inner ardor, that's important) with all out war.

creator: ABIBs_BrotherInLaw
name: [1.0.3.5] Emotion coins go brrrr
description:
Defensive deck based on abusing Opportunity spotted to generate emotion coins and quickly go up in emotion. Intended for use in Geb's floor to reach Mountain of Corpses quickly while also keeping the sacrificial nuggets alive. 
Opp. Spotted generates 3 emotion coins when one-siding and 7-8 when clashing regardless of the amount of enemy dice. The amount of coins you need for lvl I/II/III/IV/V is 3/4/6/8/10 so you can see why we want this card. Still, only use them at low emotion lvls if you are sure you won't be able to generate the required coins otherwise (You get 1 coin when winning/losing a clash and 1 when maxrolling/minrolling).
Pages do not really matter, though Mei (stagger heal on emotion up) and Rhino soldier (Endurance + Protection + it is a blue page so you are not wasting a purple page on sacrifice fodder) are really good choices.
Here we are aiming for negative emotion coins (Mountain is a breakdown page) so most of our cards are defensive but low-rolling. You can change them for better-rolling cards if it suits you better (Iron wall/Bulky Impact/Golden opp replacing one of the Energy shields, for example)

creator: Nihilist_Illya
name: Clone Storm
description:
The goal of this deck is to abuse Chesed's level 3 abnormality page 'Magic Trick' to the absolute extreme.

This is done by using Purple Tear's unique page 'Mirage Storm' and using 'Clone' to make a total of four copies of it, the using 'Magic Trick' to set all of their costs to 0 to use all four in a single scene. Having 'Courage' is also highly recommended for the 3 strength, even if you lose librarians, you can use 'False Throne' on the turn you use the 3 'Clone's in order to reset 'Courage' to max.

I put this deck on the pierce stance in order to maximize the third dice and its effect, applying a total of 24 bleed and 8 fragile base on that and the next scene (assuming all third attacks hit). At least one of your other stances should have strong draw capability in order to reach a hand of 7-8 before switching to pierce to ensure you can find all of your pieces to the combo.

As for attributes, anything that gives strength or increases bleed applied will help, such as Liu Association's 'Fervor' and Yang's 'Digging Shank'. Cecil's 'Firm as a Great Mountain' is also a good choice to maximize survivability while working to emotion level 5.

creator: Chubbs
name: Xiao Stall Burn
description:
The goal of this deck is to use burn's condition free damage to buff up Netz's floor, which is super strong at surviving but not at dealing damage. This deck works hand in hand with that, providing lots of damage in the form of +power modifiers and free burn every turn, while also providing AoE burn. Additionally, Chi Wen helps the librarian survive to let the burn do its work, and boots some respectable rolls for itself as well. The counter die also cover for rolls you don't want to dedicate clashing with, but can't ignore. 

In long, drawn out acts, which Netz excels at, you shouldn't have any problem with your hand or light thanks to Unlock, Serpent Sword Technique, and Class and Respect. While you won't be full hand 24/7 or full light like Singleton often is, you'll almost always be in a comfortable position to use what you want, when you want. 

Xiao's Raging Storm can easily be replaced by her other exclusive, Jin Ni. You can swap it out on preference, or simply by what the node values more.

creator: civilCornball
name: Blunt Boris
description:
(Deck viable very, very early in Star of the City. The furthest you need to go is The Thumb II and Liu Association Section 2 I.)
(Optional: Replace Respiration with Concussion (extra Blunt stagger damage) from Puppet, Page 2.)

An upgraded version of the classic Blunt Puppet deck.
Makes use of Respiration to clear space for the amazing 2-cost Blunt cards.
Boris is the only page that can make use of Discipline, a card specialized towards getting as many one-sided attacks in as possible.

Puppet Blockade - The genners. These help you move out of the Respiration Cycle.
Creak - Midrange card, slams HARD with +2 Blunt Power.
Steel Knuckles - Draw power. Only *slightly* worse than Creak as a result.
Sturdy Defense - The "Oh Shit" card. Also grants card advantage. (If you don't have it, run Repressed Flesh instead)
Discipline - Hey, do you want to dent your opponent's face in without needing to take a one-sided attack? Well, here you go!

Recommended Abnormality Pages on the Floor of Technology:
-[I] Metallic Ringing (easy to obtain, and it's practically free Paralysis for something you're going to do anyways)
-[II] Coffin (You're gonna be slamming face a lot.)

Leave Lament [II] to your ranged nugget. They can get much more out of it.

creator: ABIBs_BrotherInLaw
name: Discard Olivier
description:
It actually works with any page as long as it has Margin. I prefer Olivier because his 12 fixers passive brings Daring Decision on pair with SoTC/Impurity 3-costs. He also has Trigrams which is an amazing ability.
The reason why this deck works so well it is because Margin and In Times Like These! check your hand at the end of the current scene, and Brace Up draws only at the beginning of the next one, so you are not permanently stuck with only 2 cards after playing DD like you used to. Just be careful when playing Clone, make sure it gets played before anything that discards your hand, and that Impugnatio Ultima is in your hand when it is played.

As for floors, it can work on any, really. This deck here is a generic one, feel free to make changes to it to suit the capabilities of the floor you chose (ie: On Yesod's floor, All-around helper can grant you enough light that you could do with one less Forward March. On Malkuth's, you probably would want to replace one Daring Decision with another Clone to abuse Happy memories, and so on)

creator: devin62501
name: Boris's Benign Beatings
description:
This is the biggest meme I've ever come up with in this game.
General idea is to get a bunch of Disciplines, and use Brawl to copy the dice on your first die with Myo's Prowess, and The Strongest, from Myo's and Red Mist's Key Pages respectively. Since Discipline isn't able to be affected by Strength, your goal is to use Brawl to copy the die and their effects, so that you do a bunch of swings which're all getting a +6 to them.
This probably is useless in even the suggested rank, but since it uses SotC Key Pages, figured that's the only rank to really pick.

creator: Wenamen
name: Yujin Handlock
description:
Note that you CAN build a Yujin Handlock back in Urban Nightmare, this is an upgrade from my Yujin's Basics. As you may notice, I absolutely love this page.
So basically, what you want to do is play ToC, Gale Kick and Frontal Assault (you can choose whatever light regen page you want) for 1 or 2 scenes to fill your hand, then you profit from it playing Ink Over + ToC as much as you can. That's it, Oonga Boonga.
Although you won't benefit from Yujin's free 25% bonuses from Faint Memories and Endless Struggle, you'll ditch out big damage almost every turn.
You can switch Gale Kick for Steel Knuckles, but I prefer Gale Kick cause it carried me over Servant of Wrath's abno battle
You can also sneak a Boundary of Death instead of a third Ink Over, but I'm no gamble addict so no thanks...

As for passives you have a wide useful variety, pick your poison
- Singular Strike (Gale Kick go brrr)
- Remembrance (To sacrifice someone else and profit)
- Lone Fixer (Of course you wanna try it out)
- Corpse Cleanup (In case you get ditched by mass attacks or targeted at the broken die)
- Mind/Health Hauler (Same)
- Whatever else you can find

creator: ABIBs_BrotherInLaw
name: [Meme in extreme] Singular Strike Burning Flash
description:
I don't know which patch did it, or if it is even intended, but as of now, when Burning Flash adds the die of another Burning flash in your hand to itself, that 2nd die also benefits from singular strike, turning it into a 8-12 / 8-12 page, which are amazing rolls for a 2-cost and helps us circumvent the main weakness of singular strike decks (the fact that playing cards with 1 die leaves you open to a lot of free attacks). 
I have found getting a good turn 1 hand makes a world of difference for this build, which is why Battle Ready (draw +2 on first turn) is really important. This passive is found on Sayo's page which also has Dark Cloud Blade (+1 Slash power) so it is even better.
When using clone, make sure there is a Burning Flash in your hand (remember that Burning flash discards 1 other burning flash in your hand) so you don't end up cloning the wrong thing. To Overcome Crisis and The Will of the city (despite not being singular) are there for the draw because I've found that you will need it in long fights (also if your starting hand sucks even with Battle Ready)
It is a meme deck but a really fun one. You can put this build on any page but if you are a die-hard memer you will turn this into your Purple Tear's slash deck for that sweet +2 Power and +50% damage dealt.

creator: Wenamen
name: Rose's Singleton
description:
Basic Warp-Charge deck to constantly sustain Ripple and Fully charged Rip Space. 
Rewind, Will of the Prescript and Ripple offer high evade rolls, you can make them better with a Gears Worshipper's Thought gear, although it's not really necessary. 
You can change Extract Fuel for another light regen option.
I personally like Fleet Edge here to secure Rose's Quantum Leap with haste, but you can change it for To Where the Prescript Points or Execute for high damage, or Flying Sword for a lower cost Haste. However, this deck has a lot of pierce dices, so I recomend Fleet Edge + Wedge passive + Art Abno pages. You can also boost the Pierce Dices even more with Grace of the Prescript although it won't ever boost Pierce

creator: Wenamen
name: Yujin's Basics
description:
This deck benefits from Yujin's Extreme Fatigue to boost Faint Memories and Endless Battle, while constantly getting light/cards using at least 1 ToC every scene.
Basically, you wanna take clashes with Faint Memories or Desperate Struggle, depending on your preference between Block and Evade, and use ToC as a one-sided free draw/light-regen.
Flying Sword's haste should help you take over any attack directed to Yujin's broken dice. I also prefer Automated Movement over the other counter-dice pages here, as AM also grants haste.

An alternative to this deck to Handlock/Ink Over
- 3 To Overcome Crisis
- 3 Flash of Sunup
- 2 Faint Memories
- 1 Ink Over
If you're confident you can constantly draw pages (using ToC and/or Flash of Sunup every scene), you can dish big damage every 2-3 scenes with Ink Over

I recommend using Yujin on Language floor to constantly get strength with Crimson Scar abno page, but you can also take it to Literature and buff it with Axe-Alertness-Gooey Waste
GLHF

creator: Wenamen
name: Yujin's Smokin-Hot Evasion
description:
This is a direct upgrade to my Yujin's Basics deck and it shares it's basics.
What we change here: Smoke cards. That's it, that's the whole point.
You can switch Faint Memories with Endless Battle if you prefer Block over Evade, as both cards are still pretty decent. However, you might want to switch one of them with Hidden Blade, as it's a lower cost high evade.
Ink Over requires a lot of tunneling and page draws to consistently get damage, so we can now change it for Deep Drag for high damage
Inhale Smoke every now and then to boost Hidden Blade's dices and your overall damage (Puffy Brumes required), and you now have an even more constant Yujin Evasion deck

I'm keeping the Haste here for the same reason I explained on Yujin Basics, but now you can also switch it for a Trace of Fumes. Later in Star of the City you can get both damage and haste with Fleet Edge.
I'm recomending Gears Page Effects here, but you can also get Puffy Brumes on Smiling Faces pages and boost Evade Dice with Walter's Page

creator: SeiunKure
name: Overspeed Elena
description:
The main goal of this build is to abuse Happy Memories to deal immense amounts of damage using Overspeed and The Strongest + Myo's Prowess, alongside Puffy Brume and Ever-spinning Gearwheel to amp it up further.
- Graze the Grass is your light restore and (technically) your page draw card due to Leap. Use it often, especially when setting up the Happy Memories abuse at first.
- I put Leap on this deck because I had some major issues with page draw in longer fights. It's fueled by the Charge from Graze the Grass, which will likely be used a lot anyway.
- Clone's job is to clone Overspeed, giving you 5 copies.
- Ever-spinning Gearwheel helps push Overspeed's damage even higher with Smoke. It also serves as your (somewhat mediocre) Mass Attack counter, since Overspeed's power effects don't activate against Mass Attacks.
- Overspeed is the main damage card, giving +11 power if used on an infinity die. Try to use it to clash especially dangerous attacks, since it'll likely win against them. Don't use it against Mass Attacks, though.

This deck really seems to shine in longer, single-Act, multi-phase fights like Floor Realizations or boss battles. It can work well on multi-Act battles, but it has trouble getting set up on later acts due to mainly relying on Emotion Level increases to regenerate Light at first. It also struggles against Mass Attacks without Ever-spinning Gearwheel, and even then it doesn't do very well against them.
NOTE: I attributed Smoke Addiction to this build too, but couldn't fit it into the passive slots here. It really helps other allies win their clashes.

This deck is a Rapid gash deck that can be used by anyone, no matter the passive, core page and no required abnormality page.
this deck relies on two card as the engine, and those 2 being Unlock and The Will of the City. Snake slit is present to act as a pseudo strengthed, since the first 2 dice of Rapid gash is slash, and therefore would benefit from the slah dice +2. if you havent finished the third reception after the smile face, use Sharpen up from kurokumo clan instead.
One keypoint: this deck focus on dmg output, not clashing ability, as rapid gash is virtually incapable of clashing.
If you are so keen on using this with Yujin, consider remove snake slit and bring Observe from the gaze office with you, since she is capable to make the light meter go backward and regen light as she attack (overbreath activate if the original cost of the cards are 4 or higher, and rapid gashes does satisfy the condition; so if the cost of rapid gash falls below one, rapid gash is the light engine of the deck)
the list of passive are some of the suggested passive to bring with you if you want to run this deck. then fill rest of the passive slot with passive you want.

**IMPORTANT**: The order in which you attribute passives MATTERS. Make sure 'Margin' appears before 'Bottom deal' in the equipped passives list. This is because passives higher in the list proc first and otherwise Bottom deal would prevent Margin from happening.

name: Udjat (aka Dias' Simps) protection stacking
description:
Imagine taking HP damage
this post was made by the Udjat Gang

Works best when using the 3 Udjat pages on the same floor. Hokma's floor is preferred because team-wide HP/Stagger heals to deal with chip damage, though any floor with HP heals (ie Hod's) will work, as the Udjat heal back some stagger damage  each scene and even if they are staggered, the dmg reduction from protection happens before the damage increase from fatal resistances so you'll most likely still take 0 damage.
Complement it with your other 2 nuggets also using teamwide prot cards (ie Ready Up! and Confrontation) and lmao your way to victory

(Can work without Battle Ready but it is much less reliable and takes longer to come online)

name: Sigleton Crying Children V1
description:
First Effective Crying Children iteration
Up to this point you should have Leap-Cycle for consistant Light-Card supply. If not, you can replace Energy Cycle with Gigigig, although there's no replacement for Leap
Singleton's are your best damage options up to this point, and Will of the Prescript is essential for any deck's health
Sharp Nails can be replaces with any other High Card, Blazing Strike is Blazing Strike

EFFECTS:
You want to get as much burn as you can using this page, so you want Stigma Workshop and maybe Flaming bat. After that it's your choice
This page has an amazing synergy with Salvador's Page

Same as before:
Leap-Cycle is still great and consistant Light-Card supply, Will of the Prescript is solid page draw and Blazing Strike is Blazing Strike: Use it! Use it!! Use it!!!
Oh, and Emotional Turbulence is better than Sharp Nails in terms of escalating power, but you can still use Sharp Nails if you're Stagger starving
Upgrades!
Golden Opportunity makes a metter defensive tool than Rewind and charges up for Energy Conversion with some extra charge for later use. Inner Ardor is "Crack of Dawn" but cheaper and emotion building, so you can clash more without the need of excesive page draw. Then you can Blazing Strike and change for sustainable damage. Also, more emotion coins mean more Fourth Match Flames.

creator: SuspiroAtroz
name: Ominous Smoke
description:
My own improvement on the idea of a deck using Ominous Power as it's main form of light generation, alongside 3 cost cards that replace themselves when used, to keep a consistent flow of cards going. Inhale smoke with puffy brume means that your attacks will hit extra hard, and it helps on the early stages of the fight if you draw it so you can use two dices before you get 6 light, allowing you to climb emotion levels faster. Repressed Flesh gives you a card that replaces itself which also gives you a chance to stave off some attacks directed your way, and gives you a way to respond to 3 dice pages without potentially wasting your losses of senses. 

However all the other 3 cost pages that replace themselves are viable in here, with Vapor being a page I used to use before since it allowed me to completely blank ranged pages (In the end I changed it to Inhale Smoke because IS gives you all the Smoke to yourself you could need, while Vapor is somewhat inefficient in both applying and giving smoke if you aren't already using other sources that give and receive smoke). For this reason if you're facing ranged pages I recommend Celestial Spear in place of Repressed Flesh.

The general idea is to use Deep Drag in your highest die, then follow up with both Losses of Senses to draw all your hand and inflict the enemies with immense amounts of paralysis, specially if you're attributing the smiling faces page that gives paralysis to high smoke targets.

This setup becomes specially powerful if you can grab Lies from Keter. While sometimes it can raise the cost of your OM, the fact is that it often the cost reduction means you can use all of your dices in the later stages, even if you're using a key page that doesn't starts with 4 light. This setup is also rather good to use ego pages, as you will likely always have enough light to spam them with OM, and if you already drew all your other non-OM pages, then you're guaranted to do so the next turn to allow you to instantly recover from the expenditure.

creator: Wenamen
name: SotC Charge Singleton
description:
Haven't seen much Cane or Charge decks here so I'm uploading mine.
This works in virtually every floor, as Nemo's deck serves mainly as a tank, but also as an effective support.
I'm not putting Leap-Cycle here, singleton deck sustaint are my new best friends. If you don't have them yet, be sure to have reliable page draw.
As most SotC charge decks, [Absorb Impact; Golden Opportunity] into Energy Convertion will serve as an easy combo to reliably gather charge while mainteining a healthy light regen.
SofC charges are mainly focused as defensive options, so most of the time [Energy Beam; Devastating Thrash; Uncanny Strike] will be your only damage oriented cards. And pretty good ones too, as they deal lots of Damage one way or another (for a tank).
Ready Up is there for supportive function, but you can replace it with Somber Precaution, Execute or even Iron Wall
Again, remember to have reliable page draw, as Energy Beam or Uncanny Strike can give you crucial advantage by denying your opponents to act.

name: Night Awls Deck
description:
Building a sustainable Night Awls deck is tricky, as you want to use as least non-pierce dices as possible.
On the other hand, Chink in One's Armor makes Allen's the first Haste-Bind oriented page in the game (Rose doesn't count, she also requires RNG).
Thanks to Stilleto passive, Frontal Assault gets an upgrade from "One side unless you want to lose a clash" to "Maybe clashable", which also makes it the best light regen for a Pierce-Only deck.
Since neither Leap-Cycle nor Singleton supply pages are viable here (cause Stilleto), Sparklling Spear and Gale Kick are a must for you to not Draw-Starve. Don't worry, Sparking Spear will consistently clash in your favor here.
Every other page will serve as Haste-Bind inducing 6-[10;11] clashes, which will build up to a devastating Stiletto finisher.

creator: SeiunKure
name: Twelve Sins (Binah Discard)
description:
This discard deck is a modified version of another Olivier Discard deck I saw here, updated with new General Reception cards and tailored for abuse of The Weight of Sin.
- Olivier's Page is the centerpiece of the deck, since The Twelve Fixers causes Graze the Grass's second die and Final Stroke's first die to always roll the same value, which will proc The Weight of Sin each time. The consistent boosts will chew through your Librarian's HP, but they'll make it very difficult for you to lose clashes at the same time.
- Graze the Grass can be substituted with Frontal Assault for more damage with 2 offensive dice in exchange for a weaker second die. Wedging Thorn can also be used for more consistent rolls and Fragile, but it comes at the cost of guaranteed The Weight of Sin procs.
- The ideal strategy is to play Final Stroke or Impugnatio Ultima and Brace Up on the same scene. Due to how Brace Up draws at the start of the next scene, Margin and In Times Like These! can proc, letting you draw at least 4 cards. At higher Emotion levels, also play Graze the Grass for more Sin procs and Light restoration or more Brace Ups for better heals next scene. Trigrams can help compensate if Final Stroke or Impugnatio Ultima is not drawn.
- This deck is best used with a Guardians of the Forest team, especially with a Ranged user (like Binah) using Tilted Scale to compensate for the extreme HP drain. Health Hauler can also be attributed if needed.

effect: Contracts: At the start of the Act, add Unsigned Contracts to the hands of all allies. If a character fulfills the condition stated by the Unsigned Contract in their hand, its effect will be granted, and the Contract will exhaust. It is possible to exchange Unsigned Contracts with another ally.
Mind Hauler: Recover 2 Stagger Resist on a successful attack
Health Hauler: Recover 2 HP on a successful attack
Remain Vigilant in Peace: Whenever the Emotion Level rises, recover 25% of Max Stagger Resist unless the character is staggered
creator: SeiunKure
name: Fourth Pack Contracts (Light)
description:
Contracts teams are pretty fun to use if built right, so why not? This Nikolai build is meant for use with the Contract of Light, and it's practically meant to be a massive support and healer.
- Since the Contract of Light will count Light restored from combat pages as unspent Light, builds focused around it need to have no Light regen at all. Strong page draw capabilities are also recommended since it's hard to spend Light with a lack of pages.
- The main goal of the deck is to rush to Emotion Level 2 and 11+ Charge ASAP while grabbing Baptism along the way to help consistently empty its Light each scene. It works well with Advent and Apostles due to how much Baptism's going to be used, too. Access to Baptism also helps prolong the rest of the team's lifespan and allows you to save healing passives for other floors and builds, and its Endurance buff lets the Contract of Swiftness proc a little easier.
- Nikolai is used as the main page for a few reasons. First of all, The Commander gives a solid team buff at 11+ Charge, one that can easily proc the Contract of Might. Finishing Touch helps a lot with defeating enemies faster, and access to Battle Command enhances the build's supportive role.
- Rooster's Crow can be replaced with Bi Xi for better clashing or another Bulky Impact for more Charge.
- Since Baptism can't be used on yourself, Health Hauler and Penitence are almost required for their sustain after scenarios where you have some Light left over and can't spend it. Mind Hauler and Remain Vigilant in Peace are used to keep Stagger Resist high, since I had some issues staying alive and un-staggered while setting up.
- This deck struggles greatly before the Contract of Light activates, and it especially struggles at the start of a new Act since all the Contracts are shuffled around.

When you have The Twelve Fixers equipped, you get lots of minrolls, which means lots of negative emotion coins, which means higher chance to get weight of sin. I chose Elena for this deck because her absurd healing power all but nullifies the damage you take from Weight of Sin. Crimson Claws is your main weapon, Unlock, Forward March and Will of the City are for light regen and page draw, Sturdy Defense for emergency page draw and beefy defense, and Unending Thirst for beating the tar out of everyone. You can replace Unending Thirst for another powerful page like Divinatory Impact or Fervid Emotions, or even Bloodspreading if you want a mass attack.
